title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
vmassol left at 00:06 ( xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 01:30 CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:31): !who xwiki-bridge - (01:31): \* members: Enygma` left at 02:16 ("Leaving." CalebJamesDeLisl left at 02:40 ("barjavel.freenode.net irc.freenode.net" mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:30 kibahop joined #xwiki at 08:06 vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:29 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:06 vmassol - (09:11): sdumitriu: good morning. I've replied to your vote mail. I couldn't check the incubator though since it's down (I assumed in my answer it was roughly similar to what was there 2-3 days ago) lucaa left #xwiki at 09:32 vmassol - (09:36): mflorea: you've probably seen it but there are 7 wysiwyg tests failing mflorea - (09:37): vmassol: yes, I'm investigating. vmassol - (09:37): k tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:45 arkub joined #xwiki at 09:50 Enygma` left at 09:53 (Remote closed the connection vmassol - (09:56): any taker for http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4795 ? :) vmassol - (09:56): I'll do it vmassol - (09:56): vmassol: thanks for taking it! you rock vmassol - (09:56): I know, thanks :) mflorea - (09:58): :) KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:01 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:07 xwiki-bridge left at 10:08 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out) lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:19 xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 10:21 tmortagne - (10:48): mflorea: did you had time to commit en/fr translations for macros descriptors ? mflorea - (10:48): tmortagne: not yet. let me do it now mflorea - (10:49): first, I'll add the default keys tmortagne - (10:49): mflorea: ok thanks vmassol - (11:07): lucaa: do we need this tutorial any more http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents ? vmassol - (11:07): (now that we have http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/ComponentModule) vmassol - (11:08): hmm a tutorial is probably needed. The reference doc is just refefence and not a step by step tutorial vmassol - (11:08): hwoever most of the content of the tutorial should be removed since it's in the reference doc and deprecated lucaa - (11:13): vmassol: yes, the tutorial needs to be updated, and maybe some parts of it removed. But we need a step by step tutorial to guide through, to let devs know how to assemble together and use the information in the module ref doc vmassol - (11:14): yes vmassol - (11:14): agreed mflorea - (11:24): tmortagne: how can I update l10n? I committed the macro descriptor keys but they are not counter as empty keys for the rest of the translations yet. tmortagne - (11:25): mflorea: each translation file on l10n provide an "Import/reimport default language file" tmortagne - (11:25): here it's on http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources tmortagne - (11:27): otherwise you can wait for tonight for it to be done automatically tmortagne - (11:27): when you will commit fr translation you can import it in l10n using "Import" action for fr in the table mflorea - (11:27): ok, thanks tmortagne - (11:28): note: "Import/reimport  default language file" take a long time because there is a lot of translation so its possible you get a timeout vmassol - (11:29): I hope JV didn't have any good reason for adding this CreatePage document.... :) tmortagne - (11:30): mflorea: what is "rendering.macroContent=Content" ? tmortagne - (11:30): isn't it part of the WYSIWYG UI ? mflorea - (11:30): the label for the macro content mflorea - (11:31): it's like the name of a parameter mflorea - (11:32): s/label/name. It is used as label. tmortagne - (11:33): hmm ok tmortagne - (11:34): we will have to improve en values for enums i think tmortagne - (11:34): "VERY\_SMALL" is not very pretty fur UI mflorea - (11:34): yes, we can change the translations tmortagne - (11:36): defaultValue is not a label, it's a technical value tmortagne - (11:36): should not be part of the translations keys mflorea - (11:39): wait, I had a reason for adding it tmortagne - (11:40): you maybe have a hack for some reason on WYSIWYG but it has nothing to do in the translations keys mflorea - (11:41): no, for instance you have a String parameter that represents the title displayed somewhere. You can have a default title, translated in all the langauges tmortagne - (11:43): mflorea: it only make sense for strings value and not even all strings values mflorea - (11:44): yes, for the rest, the default value is empty string or one of the enum constants tmortagne - (11:45): sure but i don't see the point of having useless thing in the translation resource file, it will just mek more complex for translator to know what to do tmortagne - (11:46): for now we don't have the use case for any macro AFAIK tmortagne - (11:46): default values for things like title are generally empty strings tmortagne - (11:48): that's weird i seen you committ mail but i can't find the keys you added in http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties mflorea - (11:49): yes, I went through all the defaultValues and they are either numbers, enum constants, technical values (like CSS class) or empty so it's ok to remove them. tmortagne - (11:50): i will clean them (but when i can get your modification, i don't understand what's wrong with svn) mflorea - (11:50): yes they are, search for "macro descriptors" tmortagne - (11:50): browser cache issue it seems tmortagne - (11:50): first time i have this issue on svn repo mflorea - (11:52): ok, so you want to remove the defaultValue keys? otherwise I can remove them myself. tmortagne - (11:53): if you can do it easily would be cool tmortagne - (11:53): at worst i can always do a regexp on Eclipse mflorea - (11:54): I would do the same :) tmortagne - (11:54): ok tmortagne - (11:54): also i don't think categories should be mixed with macro descriptors like it is in your committ tmortagne - (11:55): since it's too different things mflorea - (11:56): that is because in my code I translate macro descriptors, not macro categories. that is, I have a method that gets a macro descriptor and translates it, logging the keys. I can separate manually the categories. tmortagne - (11:57): ok you can move rendering.macroContent=Content with categories too since it's also a general macro related translation mflorea - (11:57): ok, I'll do so tmortagne - (11:58): will be easier to extract macro translations without breaking general translations latter vmassol - (12:08): !shutdown xwiki-bridge left at 12:08 (Remote closed the connection xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 12:08 vmassol - (12:08): hmm still cannot connect to jabber, I wonder why vmassol - (12:12): guys I don't like this property name and value: vmassol - (12:12): platform.core.profile.editMode=Menu edit mode vmassol - (12:12): since it's not just about menu mode vmassol - (12:12): it affects several other places vmassol - (12:13): (it's for simple and advanced users) vmassol - (12:15): guys should we all move back to jabber now? vmassol - (12:15): I see marius and thomas are not logged on jabber right now vmassol - (12:16): it looks more stable to me tmortagne - (12:16): vmassol: ok, but bridge does not seems to work, right ? vmassol - (12:16): yes we need to fix it jvelo joined #xwiki at 12:16 vmassol - (12:17): for ex guillaume and jerome are only on jabber mflorea - (12:17): vmassol: you said "hmm still cannot connect to jabber, I wonder why" how is it more stable? vmassol - (12:17): jerome is here now vmassol - (12:17): mflorea: the bridge has an issue vmassol - (12:17): not me vmassol - (12:17): we're 15 on jabber right now mflorea - (12:17): ok vmassol - (12:17): 16 actually jvelo - (12:17): I'm there jvelo - (12:17): :) mflorea - (12:17): I can switch jvelo - (12:17): jabber was very slow for me vmassol - (12:17): I think we should be on both FTM jvelo - (12:17): but worked vmassol - (12:18): yes just realized it's slow for me too tmortagne - (12:18): jabber is very very slow for me vmassol - (12:18): so maybe let's stay on both for a few days more? vmassol - (12:18): let's also fix the bridge.... vmassol - (12:18): I tried the other day and couldn't understand why it wasn't working vmassol - (12:18): the config looks ok to me tmortagne - (12:18): maybe the bridge just get a timeout mflorea left at 12:19 ("Leaving." tmortagne - (12:19): it took me more than 2 minutes to connect vmassol - (12:19): hey marius come back :) vmassol - (12:20): what about: platform.core.profile.userMode=User Mode ? vmassol - (12:21): (instead of platform.core.profile.editMode=Menu edit mode) vmassol - (12:22): or user Type vmassol - (12:22): since that's also the technical field name vmassol - (12:22): sounds even better than mode to me tmortagne - (12:24): yes jvelo - (12:24): vmassol, here the message I propose upon initial import of the XE XAR: "You have imported XWiki Enterprise default set of documents. From this point, you can for example visit the home page of your wiki. To continue administer the wiki, you will need to authenticate first.", WDYT ? jvelo - (12:24): with links to home page + login pag vmassol - (12:24): I think we need to explain jvelo - (12:24): s/pag/page vmassol - (12:25): that the user was running with no security before jvelo - (12:25): explain why the need to authenticate ? vmassol - (12:25): and that now user authentication emchanism  has been imported vmassol - (12:25): making the wiki run in authenticated mode vmassol - (12:25): and thus the need to log in with a valid user jvelo - (12:25): that will be a bit clumsy vmassol - (12:26): why? jvelo - (12:26): a bit wrong too, it's the user authentication mecanism that has been imported jvelo - (12:26): that's not what really happens vmassol - (12:26): ah? jvelo - (12:26): but I see the point vmassol - (12:26): I thought it was the import the of the XWikiUsers class that did that vmassol - (12:26): is it not? jvelo - (12:27): s/its the user/it's not the user/ jvelo - (12:27): no jvelo - (12:27): it's the import of XWiki.Admin jvelo - (12:27): I think jvelo - (12:27): to be confirmed vmassol - (12:27): I don't think so vmassol - (12:27): XWiki.Admin is not required vmassol - (12:27): you can delete it jvelo - (12:27): right jvelo - (12:28): let me test somtehing jvelo - (12:29): ok you are right jvelo - (12:29): I was thinking that if there was no admin left then guest had admin jvelo - (12:29): but that's not the case jvelo - (12:30): ok jvelo - (12:30): giving another try to the message jvelo - (12:32): BTW vmassol I have this in the logs http://pastebin.com/m47554e63 jvelo - (12:32): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: An Entity Reference name cannot be null or empty vmassol - (12:32): jvelo: hmm what we should probably do (in the future) vmassol - (12:32): is force to be logged in even with an empty db vmassol - (12:33): using the superadmin account vmassol - (12:33): so when you import you don't find yourself logged out and you still have PR vmassol - (12:33): and there's nothing to explain vmassol - (12:33): :) jvelo - (12:33): yes that's a solution vmassol - (12:33): re your excpetion, how can I reproduce? jvelo - (12:34): though I know some who won't like it vmassol - (12:34): btw just got disconnected on jabber so it's not stable yet vmassol - (12:34): jvelo: ah? jvelo - (12:34): because lazy admins will forget to disable the programming account vmassol - (12:34): not having to log in is a security risk btw vmassol - (12:34): yes vmassol - (12:34): but lazy admins are bad jvelo - (12:34): and won't change the password vmassol - (12:34): and should be fired anyway jvelo - (12:34): true jvelo - (12:34): aha vmassol - (12:35): so this will increase the likelihood they'll get fired vmassol - (12:35): if they compromise a whole wiki :) jvelo - (12:35): my point is that software that help users/admins not leave breaches is good vmassol - (12:35): sure but admin is a breach vmassol - (12:35): in any software vmassol - (12:35): admin user I mean vmassol - (12:35): the admin user is much stronger security issue vmassol - (12:36): in the default DB that is jvelo - (12:36): yes but there are always things you can do to lessen the breach jvelo - (12:36): agreed jvelo - (12:36): this is way worse:) vmassol - (12:36): what we coudl do vmassol - (12:36): is not set a default password for superadmin jvelo - (12:36): we could not set a passwor jvelo - (12:36): yes jvelo - (12:36): not even for XWiki.Admin jvelo - (12:36): though this is more complex vmassol - (12:37): well vmassol - (12:37): if we have this suepradmin vmassol - (12:37): then Im' not even sure we need XWiki.Admin at all vmassol - (12:37): hmm vmassol - (12:37): not sure vmassol - (12:37): need to think more vmassol - (12:38): was thining about one use case only vmassol - (12:38): thinking vmassol - (12:38): and frogetting the second use case vmassol - (12:39): yes we could not have an Admin user I think... and make admins use the superadmin account more vmassol - (12:39): so instead of XWiki.Admin ebing the default account to log in when you start vmassol - (12:39): it would be the superadmin account vmassol - (12:39): lunch vmassol - (12:53): tmortagne: can this be closed http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3471 ? tmortagne - (12:54): depends how we see it tmortagne - (12:54): i guess we can close it saying that it's now useless tmortagne - (12:55): doing it vmassol - (12:55): tmortagne: can you do it ? (since I don't now the details) vmassol - (12:55): thanks tmortagne - (12:56): done vmassol - (12:56): thx tmortagne - (12:57): vmassol: you try to improve graphs on jira home page ? :) vmassol - (12:58): yes :) vmassol - (12:58): more seriously it's important to clean up our issues regularly vmassol - (12:58): we haven't done that for a very long time vmassol - (12:58): trying to catch up a bit tmortagne - (12:59): vmassol: sure vmassol - (13:01): guys do you know why the following generates a link for "nolink": vmassol - (13:01): {{html clean="false"}} vmassol - (13:01): vmassol - (13:01): nolink vmassol - (13:01): {{/html}} vmassol - (13:01): is it a FF bug/feature? mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:01 tmortagne - (13:01): I guess is not seens as stnadalone element vmassol - (13:02): when we put clean=true tmortagne - (13:02): vmassol: i think we already have an issue about that vmassol - (13:02):

vmassol - (13:02): nolink

vmassol - (13:02): yes we have tmortagne - (13:02): about element that should never been compressed vmassol - (13:02): trying to see if I can close it vmassol - (13:03): ah a different one vmassol - (13:03): I'm trying to close this one: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2546 vmassol - (13:03): I could put it as a dup tmortagne - (13:03): yes there is a more general one i think vmassol - (13:06): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4006 tmortagne - (13:06): yes that one vmassol - (13:06): don't know if it's exacty the same though tmortagne - (13:07): it's does sice the otehr is about xwiki/1.0 tmortagne - (13:07): but i doubt we can do anything for XWIKI-2546 vmassol - (13:07): sure but if it's still valid for 2.0 then it shouldn't be closed vmassol - (13:07): except as a dup tmortagne - (13:07): we don't touch html in xwiki/1.0 rendering vmassol - (13:08): sure but I can just swap the component vmassol - (13:08): (jira component) tmortagne - (13:09): as you want, anyway you will have to close it since there is XWIKI-4006 vmassol - (13:09): yes but it's not the same vmassol - (13:09): even if use clean=false vmassol - (13:09): I still get a pb vmassol - (13:09): so first I need to check if that's "normal" tmortagne - (13:10): that's browser issue tmortagne - (13:10): there is nothing we can do in clean=false by definition vmassol - (13:10): yes vmassol - (13:10): and works vmassol - (13:12): closed! CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 13:13 vmassol - (13:15): tmortagne: do you know if this works now: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2970 ? vmassol - (13:16): (since XTPACKAGER-6 is fixed now) jvelo - (13:31): quick question following the no-panel in edit mode refactoring jvelo - (13:31): how do we change wiki syntax? vmassol - (13:32): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/ImprovedEdit jvelo - (13:32): oh wait vmassol - (13:32): btw this image doesn't show what happens when you have 10 included documents.... :) jvelo - (13:33): hum jvelo - (13:33): that's not what I see on trunk vmassol - (13:33): it's a proposal vmassol - (13:33): :) vmassol - (13:33): there's a vote going on vmassol - (13:33): I'm still -1 now that I've looked at the latest version on http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/ImprovedEdit jvelo - (13:34): ok jvelo - (13:34): my bad jvelo - (13:34): I thought JV had commited this jvelo - (13:34): and I was not seing anything to change syntax vmassol - (13:34): nope he wanted but we talked just before he left jvelo - (13:34): but I did not import the default XAR jvelo - (13:35): so that explain why, it still happens in panels vmassol - (13:36): CalebJamesDeLisl: hi CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:36): Hi Vincent. vmassol - (13:36): CalebJamesDeLisl: would be great if you can look at http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/418/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it/DutchWebGuidelinesValidationTest/Validating\_Dutch\_Web\_Guidelines\_Validity\_for\_\_XWiki\_Registration/? too CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:37): Sure, I was just looking around Hudson. jvelo - (13:37): vmassol, I'm still trying to understand the rule that let guest import the default XAR. it's not the user class (this one is created by code upon init). it's not All/Admin group jvelo - (13:38): I looked quickly at the right service but did not find anything relevant jvelo - (13:38): sdumitriu, would you have an idea? vmassol - (13:38): it's probaby in XWikiAuthServiceImpl vmassol - (13:40): ah no vmassol - (13:40): XWikiRightServiceImpl vmassol - (13:41): found t vmassol - (13:41): it vmassol - (13:41): it's XWikiPreferences actually vmassol - (13:41):                     context.getWiki().getXWikiPreference("authenticate\_" + right, "", context).toLowerCase().equals( vmassol - (13:41):                         "yes"); vmassol - (13:41): so if the property doesn't exist then you have the right vmassol - (13:41): (nice security hole ;)) jvelo - (13:42): ok. that means the prop is in the XAR, but not created by default vmassol - (13:42): there's no XWikiPrefrences by default jvelo - (13:42): (because XWiki.XWikiPreferences is programmatically created) jvelo - (13:42): there is vmassol - (13:42): ah right jvelo - (13:42): but maybe not the object vmassol - (13:42): so it's not in the default then jvelo - (13:42): just the class vmassol - (13:42): let me ce heck that vmassol - (13:42): ah yes jvelo - (13:43): let mcheck vmassol - (13:43): there's no XWikiProperties object by default jvelo - (13:43): but there's the class jvelo - (13:43): ok vmassol - (13:43): yes jvelo - (13:44): so you actually import the "authenticated mode", indeed jvelo - (13:44): (I want to write something a bit consistent with what happens) vmassol - (13:46): jvelo: in theory you'd need to check that propery vmassol - (13:46): verify it's value is changed during the import vmassol - (13:46): s/it's/its/ jvelo - (13:47): yes I thought about that vmassol - (13:47): jvelo: or send an email summarizing what we said this morning vmassol - (13:47): agree that it's the way forward vmassol - (13:48): don't change anything for now and find someone to implement the mail vmassol - (13:48): ;) jvelo - (13:48): implement the mail, wdyt ? jvelo - (13:49): s/wdyt/wdym/ vmassol - (13:50): "or send an email summarizing what we said this morning" vmassol - (13:50): the discussion we've had together this morning vmassol - (13:50): about superadmin, etc jvelo - (13:53): ah ok jvelo - (13:53): sure jvelo - (13:53): but I still need to fix the bug vmassol - (13:53): right vmassol - (13:59): CalebJamesDeLisl: btw it would be great to have the same registration features in the admin lightbox than on the registration page, wdyt? lucaa - (13:59): vmassol: re XWIKI-2907 yes, it can be closed as won't fix vmassol - (13:59): maybe some kind of include would work lucaa - (13:59): thanks vmassol - (13:59): lucaa: can you close it since you're assigned? lucaa - (13:59): sure vmassol - (13:59): thx tmortagne - (14:00): vmassol: XWIKI-2970 is a migration issue, the fact that XTPACKAGER-6 is fixed is a details it does not fix the fact that upgrading a derby database from 1.3.1 version corrupt attachments tmortagne - (14:00): now i did not tested si i don't know if there is still the issue vmassol - (14:00): tmortagne: ok XE 1.3.1? vmassol - (14:00): because that' s not supported anymore tmortagne - (14:01): core 1.3.1, 1.3 branch is not supported but 1.4 branch is working well tmortagne - (14:01): what was not working well was the migration systeù vmassol - (14:01): ok so that problem only exists for people using XE < 1.4? lucaa - (14:01): actually, mflorea, any opinion on the tests attached to XWIKI-2907 ? tmortagne - (14:02): vmassol: i don't know since we tested with 1.7 it could be any version between 1.3 and 1.7 you try to migrate to more recent version lucaa - (14:02): do you think we should keep them and try to apply them? there are tests for formatting actions (bold italic, superscript, symbols, subscript, etc) lucaa - (14:02): ? tmortagne - (14:03): vmassol: the Priority is wrong i think mflorea - (14:03): lucaa: I don't think bring any value lucaa - (14:04): they might, but they need to be cleaned up (again) and they should also be updated... lucaa - (14:04): I will close as won't fix lucaa - (14:04): since I'm pretty positive we \_won\_ lucaa - (14:04): \_won't fix\_ it very soon tmortagne - (14:05): vmassol: but 1.4 branch is working well=but 1.3 branch is working well mflorea - (14:05): do you think they test uses cases that are not covered so far? mflorea - (14:05): I doubt lucaa - (14:05): mflorea: I doubt as well tmortagne - (14:06): vmassol: what i mean is that it's a migration issue 1.3.1 does not have any attachment issue lucaa - (14:06): that's the main reason for not trying to update them mflorea - (14:06): ok vmassol - (14:06): tmortagne: not sure i understand, could you update the isse as you see fit? :) vmassol - (14:06): s/isse/issue/ vmassol - (14:07): mflorea: is that a cool feature: http://blogs.jetbrains.com/idea/2010/01/gwt-uibinder-support/?utm\_source=feedburner&utm\_medium=feed&utm\_campaign=Feed%3A+jetbrains\_intellijidea+%28JetBrains+IntelliJ+IDEA+Blog%29 ? vmassol - (14:07): btw mflorea are you using eclipse or idea for gwt dev? tmortagne - (14:07): vmassol: 1.3.1 work well, 1.7 works well too but when you try to migrate the database (you have a 1.3.1 with its database and you change the jars) all attachments are broken, i guess attachment format changed at some point and the migration is not very good vmassol - (14:08): tmortagne: yes it's a migration issue vmassol - (14:08): the question I was asking myself is whether we'll fix it vmassol - (14:08): I'd say no since it's old vmassol - (14:09): and for old support xwiki sas can be contacted or patches sent vmassol - (14:09): but not sure mflorea - (14:09): vmassol: yes, it's a nice feature.
